column4: Hello. I acciedenly wiped my hard disc and lost my linux. Is there a way to get it back?
how did you wipe your HDD?
With Paragon Disk Wiper - I wanted to test it...
Yes. I wanted to test the program.
then you're going to need a pristinely clean electronics lab, a very powerful electron microscope, and a team of top-notch forensic's experts.
Do you know about applications such as Virtualbox?
well now consider you've learned a lesson. Don't experiment on your own HDD. When you reinstall Linux make sure you download Virtualbox or some similar application and test stuff there.
Oh, I only wanted to test the program... My HDD was full with programs... Does my hard drive get heavier when I put more data on it?
I don't understand - you mean physically?
well data stored on an HDD is essentially electromagnetic pulses so - no.
Paragon will have written over them completely. They no longer exist.
Apart from the electron microscope? Reinstallation
lesson of the day - testing stuff on your HDD != win.
It's the 4th time since I've got this computer
I've rebuilt an OS on this computer I'm on at least twenty times by now. You'll get used to it.
